Pipe tobacco: Taxed quantity

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
73411 Tobacco tax statistics

Definition:
Pipe tobacco is a product subject to excise duties, in this
case tobacco tax.
Smoking tobacco (fine cut and pipe tobacco) is tobacco that
has been cut or otherwise split or twisted or pressed into
blocks and is capable of being smoked without further
industrial processing.
Smoking tobacco is fine cut if more than 25 percent by
weight of the tobacco particles have a length or width of
less than 1.5 mm. The cut width of traditionally cut pipe
tobacco is generally between 1.5 mm and 3.5 mm.
